t: Proverbs 8
Wisdom’s Call
Does*pn not wisdom call out? Does*ld not understanding raise her voice?
At*ln the highest point along the way, where*ld the paths meet, she takes her stand;
beside*ln the gate leading into the city, at*ld the entrance, she cries aloud:
“To*ln you, O people, I call out; I*ld raise my voice to all mankind.
You*ln who are simple, gain prudence; you*ld who are foolish, set your hearts on it.
Listen,*ln for I have trustworthy things to say; I*ld open my lips to speak what is right.
My*ln mouth speaks what is true, for*ld my lips detest wickedness.
All*ln the words of my mouth are just; none*ld of them is crooked or perverse.
To*ln the discerning all of them are right; they*ld are upright to those who have found knowledge.
Choose*ln my instruction instead of silver, knowledge*ld rather than choice gold,
for*ln wisdom is more precious than rubies, and*ld nothing you desire can compare with her.
“I,*pn wisdom, dwell together with prudence; I*ld possess knowledge and discretion.
To*ln fear the Lord*s is to hate evil; I*ld hate pride and arrogance, evil*ld behavior and perverse speech.
Counsel*ln and sound judgment are mine; I*ld have insight, I have power.
By*ln me kings reign and*ld rulers issue decrees that are just;
by*ln me princes govern, and*ld nobles—all who rule on earth.
I*ln love those who love me, and*ld those who seek me find me.
With*ln me are riches and honor, enduring*ld wealth and prosperity.
My*ln fruit is better than fine gold; what*ld I yield surpasses choice silver.
I*ln walk in the way of righteousness, along*ld the paths of justice,
bestowing*ln a rich inheritance on those who love me and*ld making their treasuries full.
“The*pn Lord*s brought me forth as the first of his works, before*ld his deeds of old;
I*ln was formed long ages ago, at*ld the very beginning, when the world came to be.
When*ln there were no watery depths, I was given birth, when*ld there were no springs overflowing with water;
before*ln the mountains were settled in place, before*ld the hills, I was given birth,
before*ln he made the world or its fields or*ld any of the dust of the earth.
I*ln was there when he set the heavens in place, when*ld he marked out the horizon on the face of the deep,
when*ln he established the clouds above and*ld fixed securely the fountains of the deep,
when*ln he gave the sea its boundary so*ld the waters would not overstep his command, and*ln when he marked out the foundations of the earth.
Then*ld I was constantly at his side. I*ln was filled with delight day after day, rejoicing*ld always in his presence,
rejoicing*ln in his whole world and*ld delighting in mankind.
“Now*pn then, my children, listen to me; blessed*ld are those who keep my ways.
Listen*ln to my instruction and be wise; do*ld not disregard it.
Blessed*ln are those who listen to me, watching*ld daily at my doors, waiting*ld at my doorway.
For*ln those who find me find life and*ld receive favor from the Lord.*s
But*ln those who fail to find me harm themselves; all*ld who hate me love death.”
